results.title: Citizen soldier
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description: An impression of the life throughout the year of a citizen soldier in the Citizens Military Forces. It delves into such aspects as how effective CMF training really is, why it is important to the individual and the country and what it offers to the soldier and to his employer.

results.title: Water skiing
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines basic courtesies and safety rules and procedures of the sport. Cast includes Bronwyn Wright, Robbie Woods. Commentary by Ken Warby.

results.title: Seamanship
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the three main factors that constitute good seamanship knowledge of the boat, one’s own limitations and correct weight distribution. Commentatory by Ken Warby. Cast includes Allan Robertson, Paul Coolahan, John Kelly, Barry Duncan.

results.title: Search and rescue
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Explains the ways in which search and rescue can be facilitated should the crew in distress observe certain basic procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer.

results.title: Australia at school
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows a range of schools from small country towns through to high schools in Sydney, grades from kindergarten to last year of high school. “A film outlining Australia’s system of primary and secondary education”. Cinematography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Scouting in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Joe Scully, Australian Boy Scouts Association and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the impact upon a boy of his joining the Scouts, the involvement of his father in the Movement, the Scouts’ work in the community and the international status of the Scouting Movement. Includes scenes of a Scout Rally, an investiture, a Group Committee and the ‘Jamboree of the New Endeavour’ at Leppington, N.S.W

results.title: In-shore waters
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines some basic navigational and safety rules small craft should be aware of when boating in waters used by commercial shipping. Cast: Alan Doggett, Bob Hicks.

results.title: Hassles
results.creator_credit: Jason Ollivier, Ross Simmons, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program which takes an in-depth view of drug addiction in the day-to-day lives of ordinary people. The central character is a teenage boy who found the courage to give up heavy marijuana smoking. His motive was simply the challenge itself, but the price of his success is rejection by his lifelong friends and associates who accuse him of simply substituting one source of stimulation for another. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also ‘Thirst’ [012683] and ‘All in the same boat’ [012758].)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jason Ollivier, Ross Simmons, Robin Hughes and Film Australia

results.title: Drinking driving surviving
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alcohol plays an important part in our society as a relaxant and a status symbol, but when mixed with driving the results can be disastrous. This film explores the pressures to drink, the myths to which many Australians subscribe about drinking and driving, and the stark fact that alcohol, even in small amounts, seriously impairs driving

results.title: Angklung orchestra
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
An Angklung is a Javanese bamboo instrument which is rattled to produce a fixed note. Originally tuned to the pentatonic scale it was used in traditional music. However, today it is usually tuned to the diatonic scale and Western-style music is performed. In this film the Bandung Conservatorium Orchestra demonstrates the complexity of the instrument and plays a well-known waltz.
